name.value: North Africa: Afrika Korps vs Desert Rats, 1940-42

item.description:
North Africa (Standard Combat Series [SCS]) covers all of the fighting in the Western Desert from the beginning of Operation COMPASS until the final battles at El Alamein. This is the award-winning Operational Combat Series monster game DAK in a tighter, faster-playing SCS format.

North Africa trims one map that extended into Egypt from the original DAK format and cuts numerous unit counters and markers not needed in the SCS format. The game uses a unique activation system tied to Supply Units, which must be saved up to create large-scale offensives. Supply is scarce enough to make tracking easy and naturally is central to this critically important aspect of North African warfare.

The game utilizes Leaders, Forts, Mines, Random Events, Capture Awards, Withdrawals to Far Away Lands, and The Greek Campaign. It also includes a nifty little optional Operations rule that allows players to tie their moves into a larger plan of their own making, thus giving more context to what they are doing than is normally the case.

North Africa Scenarios:

 Operation Brevity, 1 map, 1 turn
 Operation Battleaxe, 2 maps, 1 turn
 Operation Crusader, 2 maps, 2 turns
 Gazala, 2 maps, 2 turns
 First El Alamein, 1 map, 1 turn
 Operation Compass Campaign Start, 4 maps, 24 turns
 The Race to the Wire Campaign Start, 4 maps, 20 turns
 Operation Crusader Campaign Start, 4 maps, 21 turns
 Battle of Gazala Campaign Start, 4 maps, 7 turns
 First El Alamein Campaign Start, 4 maps, 5 turns




Contents

SCS Series rulebook (version 1.8)
 North Africa Game Specific rulebook
 North Africa Scenario Booklet
 Four 22” x 34” full-color maps
 560 Counters
 Box and Dice

-From MMP's website

From the draft North Africa Rulebook: 
Each hex represents 5 miles (8 km) and a Turn is one month. 
An Activation represents 1-2 days of intense combat operations. 
Units range in size from Companies through Divisions.

This is your chance to wake up the sex beast that lies in you or hides in your pants ... all without having to lower them. In short, no need to touch to make fun! Speak dirty, mime dirty and draws dirty to score like a champion.

How's it going?

 Divide your gang into two teams.
 Choose the sex beast of your team, it's this player who dominates for the game turn.
 You draw a card. There are three types of cards: Find the dirty words, Naughty expression, Think dirty.




Who starts? It's the team whose members have had the most sex lately ... And it's not always the ones we think!

—description from the retailer

In teams of two, players must move their pawn from one corner to the opposite corner of the game board, while forming words beginning with the letters on which their pawn stops. Each word formed deserves points. The game ends when a team's pawn reaches its finish square. The team with the most points wins.

—user summary

Royal 9 Dice Poker Game is a roll and score dice party game for 2-6 players where the object of the game is to not only score specific target dice combinations for points but to also outrank your opponents scored target hands to earn even more points. The game uses a 6 dice 5 suit poker layout and a special "Royal" die that adds additional scoring possibilities and mechanics. The scoring scales proportionately when adding more players to remain balanced. The game's primary objective is to reduce the luck factor commonly found in dice scoring party games and add more strategy and decision making mechanics found in games like Poker or Rummy while still maintaining the thrill of chance and the social fun of dice party games.

—description from the designer

Embezzle or Invest? Make yourself richer and risk getting discovered, or grow the companies, enriching the competition? In Forks you give these problems to your competing boardroom members, sharing the wealth whilst shifting the blame, and always trying to avoid an audit.

Forks is a fun quick competitive card game in which players aim to give their neighbour a financially disastrous decision and choose the least bad option from those given to them. Working together, in the most un-cooperative way.

In Forks players draw three cards from the deck, choose one to embezzle (add to their hand) and pass the other two on, to the next player who chooses which one to embezzle and which to invest (add to the central tableau). At the end of the game, only the three companies with the highest values in the middle will score positive values, the rest will be audited, and players will score negative points for embezzling from those companies.

—description from the designer

Tijou is game coming form Quebec (Canada).

It is played with 

 1 game board with 36 course boxes and 4 finish squares
 4 families of 3 rooms
 1 set of 54 cards (including joker)




The goal of the game is to send his 3 pieces in ARRIVAL.
to do this, the 3 pieces must enter the course and exit (CASE ARRIVAL).

The Tijou is played by team
Each player faces his teammate and places his pieces in front of him (Off-board)

Player: A dealt cards at the rate of 5 cards per Player counterclockwise (3 + 2).

The teammates exchange 1 card, each will choose the card he gives before looking at the card he receives (It will be the same after each distribution).

The Player located to the right of the one who distributed starts = Player: B.

He then places 1 card in the center of the board and is obliged to execute the value of the card placed in one of his pieces.
Each cards has a value (go forwards/backwards of X boxes, enter in game, go to the arrival, exchanes of pieces,...)

If he can not execute the value of the card placed on one of his coins, he plays a card without playing a coin.
This is the opponent on his right to play = Player: C.
Then it's the turn of: D (then A, B, C ... so on.)
When a player has only 2 cards in his hand, he has the option to keep them, he then abstains from playing by specifying that he passes his turn.

The other players have the same choice and can continue to play until their cards are exhausted or pass their turn when they want.
(A Player can therefore keep 1 to 2 cards at the end of each turn)

Tijou ends when a player has sent his 3 pieces in ARRIVAL.
The team of this player is declared winner.
At the end of each game, it is awarded 1 POINT to each team-mate of the winning team.
Then: Change of team for a second part.
Then: Change of team for a third part.
The Player (s) with the most points at the end of 3 games is (are) declared winner (s).

The girls of K3* travel around the world.
Do you travel with them?
With this game you travel with them through five continents and over de seven seas.

There are two modules: 'De ansichtkaartenjacht' (Hunt for postcards) or 'De lange reis' (The long journey).

In 'De ansichtkaartenjacht' (easymode) you travel along a path and collect the most postcards before you are home again.
The person with the most postcards wins. Or in case of a tie, the first who arrived home wins.

In 'De lange reis' you get traveltickets (objects). Travel as fast as possible to all your destinations to collect the postcards and travel home again.
You can use shortcuts, but there is danger on the roads.

Met K3 de wereld rond is a creative, educational and above all enjoyable boardgame.

—description from the publisher (translated)


 K3 is a girlband from Belgium (originaly) for young children.
